                                                                              –3–                                          M17/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

     Question                                            Answers                                                           Notes                  Total
1.     a    i    use a colorimeter/monitor the change in colour                                           Accept change in pH.
                 OR                                                                                       Accept change in conductivity.
                                                                                                                                                   1
                 take samples AND quench AND titrate «with thiosulfate»                                  Accept other suitable methods.
                                                                                                          Method must imply “change”.
1.     a    ii                                                                                            Best fit line required for M1.




                                                                                                                                                   2




                                                                                                          M2 is independent of M1.

                 best fit line                                                                           Accept range from 0.0070 to 0.0080.
                                                 y    (0.43  0.80)
                 relative rate of reaction «                         » 0.0074/7.4 x 103 
                                                  x         50
1.     b         Relationship:                                                                            Accept "doubling the concentration
                 rate of reaction is «directly» proportional to [H]                                      doubles the rate".
                 OR                                                                                       Do not accept “rate increases as
                 rate of reaction  [H]                                                                concentration increases”.                2

                 Explanation:
                 more frequent collisions/more collisions per unit of time «at greater concentration»    Do not accept collisions more likely.
                                                                       –4–                                      M17/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

   Question                                        Answers                                                      Notes                         Total
2.   a         electrostatic attraction 
               between «a lattice of» metal/positive ions/cations AND «a sea of» delocalized   Accept mobile electrons.                        2
               electrons                                                                      Do not accept “metal atoms/nuclei”.
2.   b         (46  7.98)  (47  7.32)  (48  73.99)  (49  5.46)  (50  5.25)            Answer must have two decimal places
                                                                                             with a value from 47.90 to 48.00.
                                               100                                                                                             2
               47.93                                                                        Award [2] for correct final answer.
                                                                                               Award [0] for 47.87 (data booklet value).
2.   c         Protons: 22 AND Neutrons: 26 AND Electrons: 22                                                                                 1
2.   d    i    1s2 2s2 2p6 3s2 3p6 3d2                                                                                                        1
2.   d    ii   titanium atoms/ions distort the regular arrangement of atoms/ions               Accept diagram showing different sizes
               OR                                                                              of atoms/ions.
               titanium atoms/ions are a different size to aluminium «atoms/ions»                                                            2

               prevent layers sliding over each other 
2.   e    i    ionic
               OR                                                                                                                              1
               «electrostatic» attraction between oppositely charged ions 
2.   e    ii   «simple» molecular structure                                                    Accept specific examples of weak
               OR                                                                              bonds such as London/dispersion and
               weak«er» intermolecular bonds                                                   van der Waals.                                  1
               OR                                                                              Do not accept “covalent”.
               weak«er» bonds between molecules 
2.   f    i    TiCl4 (l)  2H2O (l)  TiO2 (s)  4HCl (aq)                                     Accept ionic equation.
               correct products                                                               Award M2 if products are HCl and a              2
               correct balancing                                                              compound of Ti and O.

(Question 2f continued)

     Question                                         Answers                                       Notes                      Total
   2.   f     ii   HCl causes breathing/respiratory problems                       Accept “TiO2 causes breathing
                   OR                                                              problems/is an irritant”.
                   HCl is an irritant                                              Accept “harmful” for both HCl and TiO2.
                                                                                   Accept “smoke is asphyxiant”.
                   OR
                   HCl is toxic                                                                                                 1
                   OR
                   HCl has acidic vapour
                   OR
                   HCl is corrosive 


     Question                                         Answers                                       Notes                      Total
   3.   a          V2O5: 5                                                       Do not penalize incorrect notation twice.
                   VO2: 4 
                                                                                                                                2


   3.    b         VO2 (aq)  V2 (aq)  2H (aq)  2V3 (aq)  H2O (l)          Accept equilibrium sign.                     1
                                                                      –6–                      M17/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

  Question                                     Answers                                        Notes                 Total
4.   a                                                                                            
             107                                                            Accept 100 to 109.5 .
                                                                                                                      1
                                                                             Literature value  105.8 
4.   b       removes/reacts with OH                                        Accept ionic equation for M1.
                                                                                                                      2
             moves to the right/products «to replace OH ions» 
4.   c       N2H4 (aq)  H2O (l)  N2H5 (aq)  OH (aq)                   Accept N2H4 (aq)  2H2O (l) 
                                                                             N2H62 (aq)  2OH (aq).                 1
                                                                             Equilibrium sign must be present.
4.   d       bubbles                                                         Do not accept “hydrogen” without
             OR                                                              reference to observed changes.
             gas                                                            Accept "smell of ammonia".
             OR
             magnesium disappears                                                                                    2
             
                                                                             Accept 2H (aq)  Mg (s)  Mg2 (aq)
             2NH4 (aq)  Mg (s)  Mg2 (aq)  2NH3 (aq)  H2 (g)            H2 (g)
                                                                             Equation must be ionic.
4.   e       no oxygen required                                                                                      1
4.   f       bonds broken:
             E(NN)  4E(NH)
             OR
             158 «kJ mol1»  4  391 «kJ mol1» / 1722 «kJ» 

             bonds formed:                                                                                            3
             E(NN)  2E(HH)
             OR
             945 «kJ mol1»  2  436 «kJ mol1» / 1817 «kJ» 
                                                                             Award [3] for correct final answer.
             «H  bonds broken  bonds formed  1722  1817 » 95 «kJ»    Award [2 max] for 95 «kJ».
                                                                         –7–                            M17/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

  Question                                             Answers                                          Notes                   Total
4.   g                                                                                Award [2] for correct final answer.
                                                                                      Award [1 max] for 44 «kJ mol1».

                                                                                      Award [2] for:
                                                                                      ∆Hvap  50.6 kJ mol1(  85 kJ mol1)
                                                                                       34 «kJ mol1».
                                                                                      Award [1 max] for 34 «kJ mol1».          2
                  OR
                  ∆Hvap  50.6 kJ mol1  (95 kJ mol1) 

                  «∆Hvap » 44 «kJ mol1» 



4.   h       i    total mass of oxygen « 8.0  10–3 g dm3  1000 dm3»  8.0 «g»    Award [3] for correct final answer.

                                  8.0 g
                  n(O2) « =                 = » 0.25 «mol»
                              32.00 g mol–1
                                                                                                                                 3
                  OR
                  n(N2H4)  n(O2) 

                  «mass of hydrazine  0.25 mol  32.06 g mol1 » 8.0 «g» 
4.   h       ii   «n(N2H4)  n(O2) =       8.0 g                                      Award [1] for correct final answer.
                                                     = » 0.25 «mol»
                                       32.00 g mol–1                                                                             1
                  «volume of nitrogen  0.25 mol    24.8 dm3 mol1»  6.2 «dm3» 
                                                                      –8–                                       M17/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

  Question                                          Answers                                                     Notes                       Total
5.   a            substitution AND «free-»radical                                             Award [1] for “«free-»radical substitution”
                  OR                                                                          or “SR” written anywhere in the answer.        1
                  substitution AND chain 
5.   b            Two propagation steps:                                                      Accept radical without • if consistent
                  C2H6  •Cl  C2H5•  HCl                                                   throughout.
                  C2H5•  Cl2  C2H5Cl  •Cl 

                  One termination step:                                                       Allow ECF from incorrect radicals
                                                                                              produced in propagation step for M3.           3
                  C2H5•  C2H5•  C4H10
                  OR
                  C2H5•  •Cl  C2H5Cl
                  OR
                  •Cl  •Cl  Cl2 
5.   c       i        24.27                 4.08                 71.65                               24.27 4.08 71.65
                  C         2.021 AND H        4.04 AND Cl         2.021               Accept         :       :       .
                      12.01                 1.01                 35.45                               12.01 1.01 35.45                        2
                  «hence» CH2Cl                                                              Do not accept C2H4Cl2.
                                                                                              Award [2] for correct final answer.
5.   c       ii   molecular ion peak(s) «about» m/z 100 AND «so» C2H4Cl2 «isotopes of Cl» 
                  two signals «in 1H NMR spectrum» AND «so» CH3CHCl2                          Accept “peaks” for “signals”.
                  OR
                  «signals in» 3:1 ratio «in 1H NMR spectrum» AND «so» CH3CHCl2
                  OR
                  one doublet and one quartet «in 1H NMR spectrum» AND «so» CH3CHCl2                                                        3

                  1,1-dichloroethane                                                         Allow ECF for a correct name for M3 if
                                                                                              an incorrect chlorohydrocarbon is
                                                                                              identified
                                                                –9–                      M17/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

  Question                                      Answers                                  Notes                     Total
5.   d                                                                   Continuation bonds must be shown.
                                                                         Ignore square brackets and “n”.
                                                          

                                                                         Accept                       .
                                                                                                                     1


                                                                         Accept other versions of the polymer,
                                                                         such as head to head and head to tail.
                                                                         Accept condensed structure provided all
                                                                         C to C bonds are shown (as single).


6.   a       Any two of:                                                 Accept all C to C bonds have same
             planar «X-ray»                                             bond strength/bond energy.

             C to C bond lengths all equal
             OR                                                                                                    2 max
             C to C bonds intermediate in length between CC and CC 

             all CCC bond angles equal 
6.   b       benzene: «electrophilic» substitution/SE                    Accept correct equations.
             AND                                                                                                     1
             cyclohexene: «electrophilic» addition/AE 
